critique: This executive order emphasizes federalism and aims to limit federal intervention in state affairs. It promotes state autonomy and encourages diverse policy approaches at the state level. It also stresses consultation with state and local governments in federal policymaking. It does not directly address immigration, national security, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The order seeks to restrain executive power by emphasizing adherence to constitutional principles and limiting federal action that would restrict state policymaking discretion. It also aims to improve internal management of the executive branch and does not create any enforceable rights.
